profileAlternative.name: Victoria Rozycki
profileAlternative.headline: Executive Support Professional
profileAlternative.summary:
Vicki provides research, web programming, and project management for a dedicated visionary in computer innovation and research. She is well regarded for her warm and approachable people skills as well as for her collaborative team work. She is versatile, artistic, and trustworthy. Among her current interests is finding ways to use her skill set in the realm of humanitarian aid. Her core competencies include:

Database management and data research and analysis
Research support and coordination
Image curation
Office management
Project management
Integrity
Confidentiality

aboutAlternative.text:

She is well regarded for her warm and approachable people skills as well as for her collaborative team work. She is versatile, artistic, and trustworthy. positions.title: MyLifeBits Co.
positions.description:
Provided research, web programming, and project management support for a wide range of Bell's initiatives. Entrusted with highly sensitive and ground breaking material. Use of strong interpersonal skills in interactions with a wide range of associates and media.

Project Highlights:

Personal Computer Timeline: Thought partner and architect of the PC timeline to preserve the history of the birth and growth of the PC Industry. Intent is to provide a one-stop-shop for historical PC information. (https://www.tiki-toki.com/timeline/entry/501712/Personal-Computers/)

The Computer Museum Website: Designed and html coded TCM website which included two extensive timelines on the life of the museum as well as its hardware exhibit collection. Researched, compiled, and organized information from multiple sources. (http://tcm.computerhistory.org/)

Bell Book Scanning Project: Managed scanning project for the Bell book collection of over 200 rare books using resources from the Computer History Museum and the Internet Archive. Worked along side IA staff using the IA Scribe book scanners. Resulted in preserving permanent records and historically valuable documents as shown at CHM. (https://archive.org/details/thecomputermuseumarchive)

Bell Artifact and Book Collection: Inventoried and organized the appraisal of the valuable Bell artifact and book collections relating to the early origins and development of measurement and computation. Required museum quality handling of all artifact and books. Resulted in preserving permanent records and historically valuable materials as shown at CHM. (http://www.computerhistory.org/collections/gwenbell/)

MyLifeBits Project: Continued to provide archival support and support to authors Gordon Bell and Jim Gemmell on their book Total Recall (paperback title "Your Life, Uploaded"), which was the culmination of the MyLifeBits project (see below). Designed and implemented the book project website, Versions 1 and 2. (http://totalrecallbook.com/)
…
see more

roles.title: Assistant to Gordon Bell - Principal Researcher, Research Emeritus, Consultant at Microsoft

positions.title:
Title
Contractor
positions.description:
Provided research and development support for world-class thought leaders Jim Gray (esteemed database guru) and Gordon Bell (computer pioneer and lifelogging visionary) on their cutting edge big data analytics research. (http://research.microsoft.com/en-us/um/people/gray/), (http://research.microsoft.com/en-us/um/people/gbell/)

MyLifeBits: Digitized, archived, and managed enormous database of information for Gordon Bell's and Jim Gemmell's research experiment in life-logging, a lifetime store of everything and fulfillment of Vannevar Bush’s 1945 Memex vision as described in his influential essay, "As We May Think". Co-developed structure of lifelogging database. Early responsibilities included researching, evaluating, and testing software in collaboration with technical support. Evaluated and recommended conversion methods for migration of obsolete media. (https://jimgemmell.wordpress.com/), (https://www.linkedin.com/in/gemmelljim), (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MyLifeBits)

TerraServer: Under the leadership of researchers Jim Gray and Tom Barclay, supported the development of TerraServer, an innovative experimental aerial and satellite imagery service - at the time the world's largest online atlas and precursor to Google Earth and Google Maps. Analyzed image data and provided feedback for quality control and continuous improvements. Assisted in creative development of and managed production of content pages for the original website. Established website mail management process.
…
see more

educations.title: Technical classes in HTML and CCS, City College of San Francisco
Art and Graphic Design studies, UC Berkeley Extension
Secretarial Degree from The Lamson College, Phoenix Arizona
Liberal Arts studies, San Bernardino Valley College, California

given.text: I've worked closely with Vicki over many years and every day she is the same: cheerful, can-do, hard-working, conscientious, warm, and caring. She's had every sort of task thrown her way and manages to figure out how to get them all done. She takes care of you and makes you feel like family.

Vicki has been my assistant since December 1999 at Microsoft Research in San Francisco. She has worked on a wide range of computing and web archive activities especially related to organizing and storing everything in one's life or the life of an organization in a computer or web site. She independently captured the entire several thousand item life of The Computer Museum that began in Boston and is now part of the Computer History Museum, Mountain View see TCM.computerhistory.org. She set up and maintains the blog, http://TotalRecallBook.com. She has been instrumental in my projects,and crucial to the MyLifeBits project that is described in our book Total Recall.. She is organized, creative, works well independently as well as with team members. She keeps focused on objectives as well as maintains accurate and thorough attention to detail. She will be a valuable asset to any organization that she joins. I highly recommend her without reservation.
…
See more

peopleAlsoViewed.text: Scientist and Technologist. Currently EIR and Co-Director, CHARIOT@USC and member of DigiKeyIH
Museum exhibition and and evaluation professional in Washington, DC.
Corporate Fundraising Strategy for Cultural Nonprofits Large & Small
at Bayou Bend, Museum of Fine Arts Houston
